text:
Hi guys, hope you're well. So we're going to make 
a beautiful dish, we're going to make Bloody Mary

Beef Brisket. It's all those flavours that you love 
in a Bloody Mary but just concentrated, roasted.

You can get it down in about 10-15 
minutes and then you let it slow cook

throughout the day. Here is the cut of meat, this is 
the beef brisket. So it's super simple, get yourself

a nice casserole pan on a high heat. We're going 
to get some olive oil into there, get it turned up.

Let's get some salt and pepper and we want 
to really rub that in all over the brisket,

plenty of black pepper, that's a really important 
ingredient so rub that all over. The brisket, you

can get from any butchers, you can ask for it, 
it should be good value. So into the oil we go.

So as this beef brisket gets some nice colour on it, 
let's just give it lots of love, turn it around and

I want to get some nice fragrant vegetables 
prepped up and ready to go so here I've got

some celery, this is going to cook for a nice long 
amount of time so you don't want to cut the veg

up too small. I'll cut nice red or white onions 
into quarters once I've peeled them and this is

going to give it a really nice base of flavour. 
Look at that, getting some colour on that already.

We'll go in with a little bit of 
bay, I'll go in with some lovely

rosemary here, then we're going to go in with 
the onions and the celery. So we'll fry these

together for five minutes just to soften it 
all up and get some lovely colour happening.

Look at that. So it's super simple to put together, 
brown off the meat, get those chunks of veg in

there and the herbs and then really I'm bringing 
the two things I love together, a chunk of beef

and a cocktail and this cocktail of course is 
Bloody Marys. We're going to go in with 750ml

of beautiful passata and then 
we'll go in with two or three generous shots

of vodka and then a nice swig of port. I'll give 
it a nice little dash of tabasco, an even nicer

shake of Worcestershire sauce. I quite like 
to freshen it up with the juice of a lemon

but this time, instead of making its way 
to a cocktail glass near you, this time

we're going to go into a casserole pan. So we'll 
mix that up. Interestingly we still want to taste

it for seasoning, so we'll season that with 
some sea salt but if you look in the pan here

we've got nice colour on this brisket of beef look 
at that! Absolutely fantastic and then all of these

veggies are starting to soften up and colour, 
so in we'll go now with the Bloody Mary mix.

I'll clean this out with some water, about 500ml
of water is perfect. We'll get the lid on

and now we're going to slow cook that in the oven 
at 130 degrees Celsius which is 250 Fahrenheit

and we're gonna slow cook all those flavours 
together. Maybe after like two, two and a half

hours I will pull it out and I'll just turn the 
meat over, baste it. But that's it, in six hours time

there's gonna be an amazing dinner here 
and what I will do is serve that with

some lovely greens, cabbages, I'm gonna make 
some mashed potato. Right, see you in six.

This whole room is full of the most 
incredible smells and also in that time,
just have a little look at this.

And if i get in here you can see how 
incredibly tender this is now look at that, yes.

So you can see that it's shiny, it's concentrated, 
it smells incredible, and then what I've got here

is some lovely greens that I've boiled, drained
and I've squeezed dry, and i'm just frying these

now in a little bit of olive oil, salt, and 
pepper, super simple. Then here I've got mashed

potato, just like you were always taught but, 
a nice little tip, take some horseradish sauce

into the mash, it works so good. Get two forks and 
then just go into this brisket and if you have a

little look, I can just literally pull it apart 
and you get this amazing pulled brisket, so good.

So let's portion some up. Get a nice generous 
pile of horseradish mash, go in with some lovely

greens, look at those colours guys, and then 
let's get some of this beautiful brisket.

Look at that and then if we just grab 
a little bit of that amazing juice

from around the outside and spoon that over the 
top, look at that. Okay, let's have a little try.

Let's get in there, let's get some of 
that beautiful beef, horseradish mash.

Gorgeous, deep flavours, sweet tomatoes. I know 
it's obvious, but it is Bloody Mary beef.

What a treat, that is definitely an incredible 
winter warmer. Guys what are you waiting for?

It doesn't take hardly any time to put together, 
go out and have a nice day out and come back
to a beautiful meal like this. Good luck.
